roles.name: Building Estimator
roles.overview: Building estimators calculate the cost of construction projects, working closely with designers, engineers and contractors to make sure projects are financially viable.

levels.title: Junior Estimator
levels.summary: Supports senior estimators by measuring quantities from drawings, updating spreadsheets and assisting with basic cost estimates.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level role for people with a trade background, certificate-level study or strong numeracy skills.

levels.title: Building Estimator
levels.summary: Prepares detailed cost estimates, researches material and labour rates and helps prepare competitive tenders.
levels.typical_experience: 3 years experience in estimating or a related construction role plus Certificate IV in Building (Estimation) or similar.

levels.title: Senior Estimator
levels.summary: Leads estimating on larger or more complex projects, reviews junior work and works directly with clients and project managers.
levels.typical_experience: Several years as a building estimator, strong track record on medium to large projects.

levels.title: Commercial Manager (Estimating Focus)
levels.summary: Oversees the financial performance of projects or a business unit, sets pricing strategies and manages commercial risk.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive experience as a senior estimator or quantity surveyor, often with leadership responsibilities.

roles.name: Contract Administrator
roles.overview: Contract administrators manage the paperwork, contracts and financial documentation that keep construction projects on track and compliant.
core_education: Certificate IV in Building and Construction (Contract Administration)

levels.title: Assistant Contract Administrator
levels.summary: Supports the contract admin team with document control, registers, reports and basic claims.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level, often while completing relevant VET or degree-level study.

levels.title: Contract Administrator
levels.summary: Manages contract documentation, RFIs, variations and progress claims for specific projects.
levels.typical_experience: 1ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ3 years in an assistant CA or project admin role.

levels.title: Senior Contract Administrator
levels.summary: Leads contract administration on larger projects, mentors junior staff and advises on contractual risks.
levels.typical_experience: Several years as a contract administrator on mid to large projects.

levels.title: Contract Manager
levels.summary: Oversees multiple contracts or major projects, negotiates major agreements and sets standards for contract processes.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive CA experience plus strong client and negotiation skills.

roles.name: Quantity Surveyor
roles.overview: Quantity surveyors are cost experts who plan, manage and report on construction costs from early design through to project completion.

levels.title: Graduate Quantity Surveyor
levels.summary: Supports senior QS staff with measurement, basic cost plans and financial reporting.
levels.typical_experience: Recent graduate or final-year student in construction management or related field.

levels.title: Quantity Surveyor
levels.summary: Prepares detailed cost plans, bills of quantities and monitors project costs during construction.
levels.typical_experience: 3 years in a QS or estimating role.

levels.title: Senior Quantity Surveyor
levels.summary: Leads cost management on major projects and provides strategic cost advice to clients and project teams.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive QS experience and responsibility for large or complex projects.

levels.title: Commercial Manager (QS)
levels.summary: Manages the commercial performance of multiple projects or a portfolio, including risk, claims and high-level reporting.
levels.typical_experience: Senior QS/estimating background with leadership responsibilities.

roles.name: Project Coordinator
roles.overview: Project coordinators keep projects organised by managing schedules, documentation and communication between stakeholders.
core_education: Certificate IV or Diploma in Project Management
Certificate IV or Diploma in Construction Management

levels.title: Project Assistant
levels.summary: Supports project teams with meeting notes, document management and basic reporting.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level or early career admin/coordination role.

levels.title: Project Coordinator
levels.summary: Coordinates meetings, schedules, documentation and communication for one or more projects.
levels.typical_experience: 3 years in project support or coordination roles.

levels.title: Senior Project Coordinator
levels.summary: Supports complex or multiple projects, often taking on quasi-project management responsibilities.
levels.typical_experience: Several years as a project coordinator on medium to large projects.

roles.name: Project Manager
roles.overview: Project managers are responsible for delivering projects safely, on time and on budget, while coordinating teams and stakeholders.

levels.title: Assistant Project Manager
levels.summary: Supports a project manager with planning, reporting and coordination tasks.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced project coordinator or engineer stepping into management.

levels.title: Project Manager
levels.summary: Manages scope, time, cost, quality and risk for a project, coordinating teams and resources.
levels.typical_experience: Several years in coordination, engineering or site roles.

levels.title: Senior Project Manager
levels.summary: Leads complex or multiple projects, mentors other project managers and contributes to business strategy.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive PM experience and strong stakeholder management skills.

levels.title: Project Director
levels.summary: Provides strategic leadership across a portfolio of projects and high-value client relationships.
levels.typical_experience: Senior or executive-level PM experience across multiple large projects.

roles.name: Construction Manager
roles.overview: Construction managers oversee on-site delivery of projects, leading site teams and making sure work is completed safely and efficiently.
core_education: Diploma or Bachelor in Construction Management

levels.title: Site Supervisor
levels.summary: Manages day-to-day site activities for a specific area of work, coordinating trades and monitoring safety.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced tradesperson or leading hand with supervisory training.

levels.title: Site Manager
levels.summary: Responsible for the whole site, including program, logistics, site safety and quality.
levels.typical_experience: Several years as a site supervisor or foreperson on busy projects.

levels.title: Construction Manager
levels.summary: Oversees multiple sites or large projects, sets delivery strategy and supports site and project managers.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive experience as a site manager or project manager.

levels.title: Operations Manager
levels.summary: Manages construction operations across a region or business unit, aligning resources and strategy.
levels.typical_experience: Senior-level construction leadership across multiple projects.

roles.name: Project Engineer
roles.overview: Project engineers handle the technical aspects of construction, linking design and on-site delivery.

levels.title: Graduate Engineer
levels.summary: Rotates through different areas of the project, learning design, site work and documentation.
levels.typical_experience: Recent engineering graduate.

levels.title: Project Engineer
levels.summary: Manages technical queries, coordinates design changes and quality tests and supports the site team.
levels.typical_experience: 1ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ3 years in engineering roles with site exposure.

levels.title: Senior Project Engineer
levels.summary: Leads engineering teams, coordinates complex technical packages and supports project planning.
levels.typical_experience: Strong experience across multiple projects.

levels.title: Engineering Manager
levels.summary: Oversees engineering delivery across multiple projects or a business unit.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive engineering and leadership experience.

roles.name: Health and Safety Officer
roles.overview: Health and safety officers focus on keeping workers safe, ensuring legal compliance and promoting a positive safety culture.
core_education: Certificate IV in Work Health and Safety
Diploma of Work Health and Safety

levels.title: Assistant Safety Officer
levels.summary: Supports the WHS team with inspections, incident reporting and toolbox talks.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level role, often with trade or site experience.

levels.title: Health and Safety Officer
levels.summary: Conducts site inspections, risk assessments and safety training and supports investigations.
levels.typical_experience: 1ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ3 years in WHS roles or relevant on-site experience.

levels.title: Senior Safety Officer
levels.summary: Leads safety on major projects, coaches teams and drives safety initiatives.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive WHS experience on large and complex projects.

levels.title: Safety Manager
levels.summary: Oversees WHS across multiple projects or an organisation, setting policy and strategy.
levels.typical_experience: Senior WHS background and leadership capability.

roles.name: Waterproofer
roles.overview: Waterproofers protect buildings from leaks and moisture damage by installing specialised membranes and systems.

levels.title: Apprentice Waterproofer
levels.summary: Learns surface preparation, membrane systems and safety procedures under supervision.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level trade assistant or apprentice.

levels.title: Qualified Waterproofer
levels.summary: Installs waterproofing systems in bathrooms, rooftops, balconies and basements.
levels.typical_experience: Completed apprenticeship or Certificate III in Waterproofing.

levels.title: Waterproofing Supervisor
levels.summary: Leads waterproofing teams, coordinates work with other trades and checks compliance with standards.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced tradesperson with leadership responsibility.

levels.title: Waterproofing Consultant
levels.summary: Advises builders and designers on waterproofing design, defect rectification and compliance.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive experience in waterproofing and defect investigation.

roles.name: Tiler
roles.overview: Tilers install tiles on walls and floors in bathrooms, kitchens and other spaces, combining precision with a sense of design.
core_education: Certificate III in Wall and Floor Tiling (CPC31320)

levels.title: Apprentice Tiler
levels.summary: Learns how to prepare surfaces, cut tiles and lay them accurately under supervision.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level trade role.

levels.title: Qualified Tiler
levels.summary: Installs wall and floor tiles, follows plans and ensures quality finishes.
levels.typical_experience: Completed tiling apprenticeship or equivalent experience.

levels.title: Specialist Tiler
levels.summary: Works on complex patterns, feature walls or high-end materials such as mosaic and stone.
levels.typical_experience: Several years tiling experience and strong design skills.

levels.title: Tiling Business Owner
levels.summary: Runs a tiling business, manages clients, quoting and staff, and coordinates with builders.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced tiler with business or leadership skills.

roles.name: Plumber
roles.overview: Plumbers install and maintain water, drainage and gas systems, playing a key role in making buildings safe and liveable.

levels.title: Apprentice Plumber
levels.summary: Learns how to install and maintain plumbing systems under supervision.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level trade apprentice.

levels.title: Qualified Plumber
levels.summary: Installs, maintains and repairs plumbing systems in residential or commercial settings.
levels.typical_experience: Completed apprenticeship and licensing requirements.

levels.title: Plumbing Supervisor
levels.summary: Leads a team of plumbers, coordinates site work and liaises with builders and inspectors.
levels.typical_experience: Several years as a qualified plumber with leadership skills.

levels.title: Plumbing Contractor / Business Owner
levels.summary: Runs a plumbing business, manages multiple teams and jobs and handles quoting and client relationships.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced supervisor or senior plumber with business skills.

roles.name: Electrician
roles.overview: Electricians install, maintain and repair electrical systems, making sure buildings are safe, reliable and energy efficient.

levels.title: Electrical Apprentice
levels.summary: Learns basic wiring, installation and fault-finding under supervision while completing formal training.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level trade apprentice.

levels.title: Qualified Electrician
levels.summary: Installs, maintains and repairs electrical systems in residential, commercial or industrial settings.
levels.typical_experience: Completed apprenticeship and licensing requirements.

levels.title: Senior Electrician / Leading Hand
levels.summary: Leads small teams, tackles complex faults and mentors apprentices on site.
levels.typical_experience: Several years as a qualified electrician with leadership responsibilities.

levels.title: Electrical Supervisor / Project Electrician
levels.summary: Plans and coordinates electrical works across larger projects, including safety, quality and scheduling.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced senior electrician comfortable with documentation and coordination.

levels.title: Electrical Project Manager
levels.summary: Manages electrical packages on large projects, overseeing time, cost and quality and coordinating with other trades.
levels.typical_experience: Strong field and coordination experience plus project management skills.

levels.title: Electrical Contractor / Business Owner
levels.summary: Runs an electrical business, managing multiple teams, contracts and client relationships.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive experience as a senior electrician or supervisor with business skills.

roles.name: Crane Operator
roles.overview: Crane operators operate lifting equipment to move heavy materials and equipment safely around construction sites.
core_education: Certificate III in Rigging or Crane Operations

levels.title: Trainee Crane Operator
levels.summary: Learns basic crane operations, hand signals and safety procedures under supervision.
levels.typical_experience: Entry-level role, often moving from general labouring or dogging.

levels.title: Crane Operator
levels.summary: Operates cranes to lift and move materials safely on site within a team.
levels.typical_experience: Completed training and licence requirements.

levels.title: Senior Crane Operator
levels.summary: Handles complex lifts, mentors junior operators and works closely with site management on lift planning.
levels.typical_experience: Strong experience operating cranes on busy sites.

levels.title: Crane Supervisor / Lift Planner
levels.summary: Plans lifts, coordinates teams and ensures compliance with lift plans and safety requirements.
levels.typical_experience: Senior crane or rigging background with planning responsibilities.

roles.name: Heavy Vehicle Operator
roles.overview: Heavy vehicle operators drive trucks and plant that move materials, equipment and waste to and from construction sites.
core_education: Heavy Rigid (HR) or Heavy Combination (HC) Licence

levels.title: Trainee Heavy Vehicle Operator
levels.summary: Drives under supervision and learns site access, loading and safety procedures.
levels.typical_experience: Junior driver or labourer obtaining heavy vehicle licence.

levels.title: Heavy Vehicle Operator
levels.summary: Transports materials and equipment safely to and around construction sites.
levels.typical_experience: Licensed heavy vehicle driver with some site experience.

levels.title: Senior Heavy Vehicle Operator
levels.summary: Manages more complex vehicle operations and supports planning of logistics.
levels.typical_experience: Several years of heavy vehicle driving on busy construction or civil sites.

levels.title: Transport Supervisor / Fleet Coordinator
levels.summary: Coordinates fleets, drivers and delivery schedules across projects.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced driver or logistics professional.

roles.name: Site Supervisor
roles.overview: Site supervisors coordinate day-to-day work on site, looking after teams, safety, quality and short-term scheduling.
core_education: Trade Qualification (e.g. Carpentry, Tiling, Waterproofing, Plumbing, Electrical)
Certificate IV in Building and Construction (Site Management) or equivalent

levels.title: Leading Hand
levels.summary: Senior tradesperson who supports the supervisor and coordinates small teams or specific tasks.
levels.typical_experience: Experienced tradesperson trusted to lead others.

levels.title: Site Supervisor
levels.summary: Manages day-to-day site operations, safety and quality for specific areas of work or smaller projects.
levels.typical_experience: Several years in a trade plus leadership experience.

levels.title: Senior Site Supervisor / General Foreperson
levels.summary: Oversees multiple work fronts and coordinates several crews and subcontractors.
levels.typical_experience: Extensive supervisory experience across different types of projects.
